author: hwright
msg: Remove a call to svn_wc_entries_read(), by using the wc_db APIs directly.
This still leaves some access baton cruft lying around, but it's much less
prevalent than it was.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/crop.c
(crop_children): Don't fetch entries, but only get the info we are
interested in, along with the children.  Do all this using wc_db APIs.

author: hwright
msg: We've started using absolute paths in wc-ng.  This makes things a bit easier
from an API perspective, but it also means we're handing absolute paths back
to the notification funtions.
The commandline client historically has used relative paths in notification
messages, for good reason.  So, this patch recomposes those relative paths
based upon the current working directory (if no other path prefix is
specified).
This now changes the output for more complex relative paths, such as
'../../foo'.  But that output will be changed anyway, as we move toward
absolute paths in the notification structs.  Further improvements to this
code could improve this situation, but I'm not focused on that just yet.
* subversion/svn/notify.c
(notify_baton): Add the default path prefix.
(notify): If we haven't been supplied a prefix by the caller, use the
one stashed in our baton.
(svn_cl__get_notifier): Fetch the default path prefix.

author: rhuijben
msg: * subversion/cmdline/svnsync_tests.py
(run_test): Open the dump file as binary stream to allow testing
for eol-style issues on Windows, which would otherwise normalize the
'\r' away. This fixes the dump file parsing of svnsync_tests.py 26 on
Windows.

author: rhuijben
msg: * subversion/libsvn_repos/load.c
(read_key_or_val): Add a few svn_error_return calls to help tracing
errors like the svnsync_tests.py 26 failure on the Windows Buildbot.

author: hwright
msg: r37876 was far too easy...and incorrect.  Revert it, since we don't want
uris turned into dirents.
